Celiac notice: It is our pleasure to offer a range of gluten free options,
however we are not a gluten-free restaurant. We have processes in
place to minimize potential risk, but ours is a small scratch kitchen
with a shared fryer, and therefore we cannot ensure that cross-
contamination will never occur.

* Ask your server about menu items that are cooked to order or served raw. Consuming raw or under cooked meats, poultry | seafood, fish or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.

Address: 207 S Main St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Choice speakeasy-style joint for farm-to-fork American-fare small plates & old-fashioned cocktails.

summary.snippet: "The food is amazing, the service is great, and this place has atmosphere."
"A great selection of small plates, appetizers, and entrees."
"They offer a good variety with consistent quality in both meals and cocktails."

most_relevant.description:
Nice ambiance and decent food-

Finally decided to try The Raven’s Club after passing by and seeing it countless times. The restaurant has a very calm pub-like vibe. The outdoor seating’s extra nice in the late summer/early fall when Main St closes off to traffic in the evening.

Ordered the chicken sandwich and honestly enjoyed it. The steak frites are also just juicy and a good deal for the portion size and price. Also liked how straight to the point the menu here is. I’d come back for sure.
Had a few visits here over the past years and I don't believe it's as good as it was before covid. The food was ok, the cocktail wasn't great, very watery. Service was reasonable.

Uh a meal in downtown Ann Arbor for four for under $100 dollars. I didn’t think that was possible and to have it be this good too… Wow.
Went here for Mother’s Day and started with the shrimp and the sprouts. Shrimp were very good and crispy but the Brussels sprouts were heavenly. Super crispy with plenty of bacon. I had the fish tacos and the fish was super crunchy maybe just add a little more sauce.  I really enjoyed the corn tortillas they came in which were lightly fried to give them a little crispness.

UPDATE:  Revisited in Mother’s Day 2024. Prices have gone up significantly.  The charcuterie board was great. The Lox appetizer was too heavy on the horseradish. The duck was overcooked and dry. Fish tacos were still good.

A great little cocktail bar in downtown Ann Arbor. The vibe and the cocktails are what really sells it.

If you're looking for a laid back experience, with decent food and a good selection of cocktails, feel free to try this out

They easily accommodated our party of four, without a reservation. Definitely worth a stop if you're downtown and down with craft cocktails.

One of my favorite spots downtown to pop-in for a quick drink and a bite to eat. The negroni is always made just right and the portions on the food are generous for the price point. The bartenders here are top-notch!!! Shout-out to Josh and Hunter for always curating a great experience :)

The food and atmosphere were delicious. We like booths and were seated in one of those round ones at the back. The decor was pretty with colored lights for the holidays. I felt a little cramped in the booth but my husband, who’s taller, was fine. My Mediterranean Pasta was delicious, but unfortunately, most of the artichoke pieces were too tough or sharp. If it wasn’t for that, it would have been a favorite. I ordered it with shrimp, which were perfect. My husband liked his Michigan trout, mashed potatoes and salad. We shared a triple chocolate cheesecake that was worth every calorie. Yum. Their desserts are made there from scratch, I believe.

First time here.

The service was great and the place had a good vibe.
I ordered Tune Poke Bowl. It was good but it was different than the ones I’ve had before. There’s usually a sweet taste in the ingredients of the bowl but this instead had pickled daikon radish which had a very strong taste and I couldn’t eat more than one piece. There was only one & a half slice of avocado in the bowl which usually is more than that.

The Brussels with bacon was really good but a bit oily, the coconut shrimp was very good.

Overall it was a good experience and I would go back.

I thoroughly enjoyed this speakeasy atmosphere but modern-day décor. It’s dark, but warm but it is also very lively. This place is popular, many bodies fill up the place with a lovely and informative staff. I didn’t know what to get at first, but I had my server explain to me the options and which ones were popular among the crowd. I tried a few different things and everything that was handed to me was great in flavor. I think the portion size for what you are buying is very fair so don’t be afraid to try more, you won’t be saddened. The food menu does change so don’t be afraid to keep up, they even have specials on cocktails and even offer flights of bourbon and more. I felt very laid back here and left alone but very much helped by staff. I can see it as a good first date place where it’s energetic but also a place where you can get to know someone, be able to hear your party and enjoy every detail of the establishment. The only other detail I would keep in mind about this place is the parking, come early to arrive on time.
